CWEs: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through an Error Message
CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
description: The function is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks because it does not limit the size of the image that can be requested. If an attacker requests a very large image, it could consume all available memory and crash the server. This is an example of CWE-400. The function also exposes potentially sensitive information in its error messages, which is an example of CWE-209. Finally, the function does not properly validate the 'url' parameter, which could allow an attacker to traverse the file system
